content.description: Stand start on the left-hand arete on the Barge and work up the arete to the top on slopers.
content.location: On the left-hand overhung side of the Barge.

content.description: Sit start on the left-hand arete with a right hand on an edge on the face, a toe hook on the arete, and a left hand on the arete low. Make several hard slapping moves up the arete and into the stand start. Climb up arete to the top.
content.location: Sit starts on the left-hand arete of the Barge and is the sit start to Steamboat Stand.

content.description: Stand start around the right arete of the overhanging face. Work up the crack and veer right on good jugs.
content.location: Stand start just around the right arete of the overhanging face on the Barge on good edges in a crack.

content.description: Sit start below and slightly to the right of the stand start just around the right arete of the Barge's main face. Use a sharp crack jug for a left hand and a sharp crimp undercling as a right hand. Sit up on bad feet and move your right hand up to a sloper in front of your face to the right of the crack. Shift your left hand into the crack in line with the sloper, get high feet that don't exist, and slap up to a horrible tips crimp in a horizontal crack up high. Hang on, get your feet situated, and then match the crack to finish as for the stand start. Tall.
Sit start on the front of the overhung face in a sharp crack. Move up and right into a big triangle feature and then to the right-hand arete. Finish as for Zap Stand.
content.location: Sit starts on the front of the overhung face near the right-hand arete. Moves up and right.

content.description: A large overhung boulder with very hard problems up the face overlooking the powerline.
